author: Joi-Marie McKenzie
title: Helena Bonham Carter Speaks Out on Split with Tim Burton
text:
Share Article 
John Phillips/UK Press via Getty Images (LOS ANGELES) -- Nearly a year after Helena Bonham Carter split with film director Tim Burton after 13 years together, she discusses the breakup and clears up a "myth" about their relationship in the November edition of Red Magazine. 
Even though the relationship wasn't "forever," the 49-year-old actress says it will always be "special." 
"I could write a thesis on what's happened and it is all-absorbing when a relationship breaks down," she tells the magazine. "But I think we're coming through it, and I think we'll have something very precious still. Our relationship was always somewhat special, and I think it'll always remain special." 
"The mark of a successful relationship shouldn't be whether you're there forever after," she continues. "Sometimes you're not meant to be forever together. Sometimes you have to come to terms with the fact that that was it." 
Carter calls their relationship "a blessing," noting, "We gave each other children and a lot more else. And we might be better, and still be able to give to each other, but not necessarily living together. 
"Which we did by the way, because everyone seemed to think we didn't, but that was a load of myth," she adds in response to rumors that the couple lived in two adjoining houses in London's Belsize Park. 
The pair, who first met on the set of Burton's 2001 remake of Planet of the Apes , never married. They have two children -- son Billy, 11, and daughter Nell, 7. 
Carter will next be seen in the British drama Suffragette , which centers on early members of the British women's suffrage movement of the late 19th and early 20th century. It opens nationwide October 23. 
The November edition of Red magazine will be available on Thursday.
